title: Public Records Request – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Drone Footage (American Fine Art Gallery Burglary – Jan 7, 2024)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of all video recordings—specifically body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and drone surveillance footage—related to the police response to a burglary in progress at the American Fine Art Gallery, located in Old Town Scottsdale, on the morning of January 7, 2024.

This incident involved the arrest of Harpreet Singh, who was apprehended on the roof of the gallery. Officers reportedly discharged pepper balls, deployed a K-9 unit, and used drone surveillance during the search and arrest. Body camera video shows officers giving verbal commands and locating burglary tools and high-value artwork on the rooftop.

Please include:

All body-worn camera footage from officers responding to the burglary call;

All dash camera footage from patrol vehicles involved in the response;

Any drone footage used to locate or surveil the suspect;

A timeframe of approximately 5:30 AM to 8:00 AM on January 7, 2024;

Any associated audio dispatch or supplemental footage if available.

If any part of the request is unclear or too broad, I am happy to revise or narrow it. If redactions are necessary, I ask that the remainder of the footage still be released. Please notify me of any associated costs prior to processing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage (March 29, 2025 Incident Involving Theft of Chicken)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available body-worn camera and dash camera footage related to an incident that occurred on or around the morning of March 29, 2025, involving the arrest of a 50-year-old male suspect for residential burglary and violation of a protection order, reportedly involving the theft of a pet chicken named “Polly.”

News reports state the incident occurred in or near Port Orchard, and deputies located the suspect hiding in the woods. Bodycam footage reportedly captures deputies confronting the suspect as he yelled, “Don’t hurt my chicken,” and one officer replying, “I won’t hurt your chicken,” before placing the chicken in a patrol vehicle.

Please include:

All body-worn camera footage from responding deputies;

Any dashcam footage from patrol vehicles related to the pursuit, search, or arrest;

Footage beginning from approximately 9:00 AM to 11:00 AM on March 29, 2025;

Any supplemental audio or video recordings associated with the incident.

If redactions are necessary, I request that the remainder of the footage still be released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News
